abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project is
            satisfactory with likely sustainability, and high
            institutional development impact, including satisfactory
            performances by both the Bank and the Borrower. Lessons
            confirm that policy environment is crucial to achieve
            success, and mitigate poverty; particularly, rural
            development facilitates decentralized approaches, provided
            devolution to local governments is accompanied by social
            empowerment. This was demonstrated by the link between the
            project and the Popular Participation Law, since it
            energized implementation, transforming the law into an
            instrument for rural development. In addition, the
            participatory process allowed local communities, and
            municipalities alike, to organize demands timely, based on a
            consensus-building effort, which suggest that, despite
            limited resources and capacities, the emphasis governing
            investments, took into account the greatest impact over the
            largest number of people, thus increasing local governance.
            This municipal participatory planning raises the quality of
            investments, since it identifies, and prioritizes demands,
            reducing inter-mediation, and, likely ensures community
            involvement, and improved service quality. However,
            participation requires responsiveness, to avoid lack of
            funding or investments accessibility, based on Government
            commitments to facilitate national, and local priorities.

            DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM,TF031188-BOLIVIA - AGRICULTURE,TF020460-NORWEGIAN CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND,TF021845-REFORMS IN THE BOLIVIAN PENSION SYSTEM,TF020400-NETHERLANDS' CONSULTANTS
            TRUST FUND,TF032069-BOLIVIA - RURAL COMMUNITY
            DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF022714-PHRD-RURAL COMMUNITY
            DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF031509-BOLIVIA - AGRICULTURE,TF034295-BOLIVIA - RURAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Rural Communities Development
            Project will: (a) alleviate rural poverty by carrying out
            rural investments identified and formulated following a
            participatory planning process; (b) enhance the
            institutional capacity of the Secretariat for Rural
            Development (SNDR), the Small-Farmer Development Fund (FDC),
            and the Secretariat for Popular Participation (SNPP) to
            carry out the project; (c) improve the capacity of
            municipalities and rural communities to implement municipal
            development plans (PMD); and (d) strengthen non-governmental
            organizations (NGOs) assisting municipalities and rural
            communities in identifying, formulating and implementing
            rural investments and managing their PMDs.
